natural solution: When using the distributive property for the first time, we add the product of $x+3$ and $x$ to the product of $x+3$ and $-8$: \begin{align} (x+3)(x-8) &= (x+5) \cdot x + (x+5) \cdot (-8)\\ &= x(x+3) - 8(x+3)
\end{align}We use the distributive property again and combine like terms: \begin{align} x(x+3) - 8(x+3) &= x^2 + 3x - 8x - 24\\ &= \boxed{x^2 - 5x - 24} \end{align}
